Title: Sophie's Choice
Production_Co: Incorporated Television Company (ITC), Keith Barish Productions
Cast: Meryl Streep, Kevin Kline, Peter MacNicol, Rita Karin, Stephen D. Newman, Greta Turken, Josh Mostel, Marcell Rosenblatt, Moishe Rosenfeld, Robin Bartlett, Eugene Lipinski, John Rothman, Joseph Leon, David Wohl, Nina Polan
Plot: After spending time with his new neighbors, an aspiring writer realizes they are harboring deep secrets that will forever change him. Sophie is the survivor of Nazi concentration camps, who has found a reason to live in Nathan, a sparkling if unsteady American Jew obsessed with the Holocaust. They befriend Stingo, the movie's narrator, a young American writer new to New York City. But the happiness of Sophie and Nathan is endangered by her ghosts and his obsessions. Written by Reid Gagle
Keywords: new york city, writer, concentration camp, holocaust, nazi

Writer: William Styron (based on the novel: "Sophie's Choice" by), Alan J. Pakula (screenplay)
